table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the sound, and not to any letter or glyph.
Dies bezieht sich auf den Laut, nicht den Buchstaben oder das Zeichen.
Namnet på ett ljud, inte en skriven bokstav eller glyf.
Ceci se réfère au son, pas à la lettre ou au glyphe.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a shortened form of {Qu'vatlh:excl}.
This might be a backfit for a line misspoken by Patrick Stewart in {TNG - The Mind's Eye:src}. The script says {Qu'vatlh:excl:nolink}, but he says {va:excl:nolink} instead.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is used to say that something is unexpected or surprising or counterintuitive, not just additional. For that, one would use {je:adv}.[2]

▶ {Qo'noS romuluS je boSuqlaH. vabDot tera' Qejbogh DIvI' ram boSuqlaH.:sen:nolink} "Kronos, Romulus and even the puny Federation's precious Earth, are all up for grabs."[1] ▶ {vabDot Sovbe' targhwIj.:sen}

table.name: mem
table.column: Selbst mein Targ wird es nicht wissen.
حتی هدف من هم نمی داند [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Även min targ kommer inte att veta. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Até o meu targ não saberá.
Même ma cible ne le saura pas. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This was the winning secrecy proverb entry, submitted by Jack Bradley ({DeSDu':n:name,nolink}), in the proverbs competition at {qep'a' 25 (2018):src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: Пусть ваши пальцы ног будут гибкими. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
The meaning of this is unclear, but it might be a wish for good fortune.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: fifth tone of nonatonic musical scale
تن پنجم از مقیاس موسیقی غیرتتونونی [AUTOTRANSLATED]
femte tonen på den nonatoniska skalan
quinto tom de escala musical não-atônica
cinquième note de la gamme musicale nonatonique
The tones of the Klingon musical scale (see {yutlhegh:n}) are: {yu:n}, {bIm:n}, {'egh:n}, {loS:n:2}, {vagh:n:2,nolink}, {jav:n:2}, {Soch:n:2}, {chorgh:n:2}, {yu:n:nolink}.
Die Töne der klingonischen Tonleiter (siehe {yutlhegh:n}) sind: {yu:n:nolink}, {bIm:n}, {'egh:n}, {loS:n:2}, {vagh:n:2}, {jav:n:2}, {Soch:n:2}, {chorgh:n:2}, {yu:n:nolink}.
Les tons de la gamme musicale klingonne (voir {yutlhegh:n}) sont: {yu:n:nolink}, {bIm:n}, {'egh:n}, {loS:n:2}, {vagh:n:2}, {jav:n:2}, {Soch:n:2}, {chorgh:n:2}, {yu:n:nolink}.

table.name: mem
table.column: {vagh reD mey' HoS:n@@vagh reD mey':n, HoS:v} "regular pentagon"[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This can actually be used for anything that acts as a cover for something one puts inside of it.[3]
Dies kann für alles benutzt werden, das als Umhüllung für etwas dient, das man hineinsteckt.[3]
Ce mot peut s'utiliser pour tout qui sert de couverture pour la chose qu'on met dedans.[3]

This was defined as "holster" in {TKD:src}, explained to include sheaths for knives in {KGT:src}, and expanded to be more general at {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2015:src}. The definition "quiver" was given in the context of storing arrows at {qep'a' 32 (2025):src}.
étui à revolver, étui à couteau

table.name: mem
table.column: so, then, thus, in that case
بنابراین، در این صورت، در این مورد [AUTOTRANSLATED]
så, därför, således, i så fall
niin, siis, siten, joten, sitten, siinä tapauksessa
alors, alors, ainsi, dans ce cas [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Note that this is not a conjunction, but an adverbial.

table.name: mem
table.column: This word refers to the concept of warriorhood (e.g., "warrior spirit", and so on). To refer to a person who is a warrior, use {SuvwI':n}.[2]
▶ {vaj toDuj Daj ngeHbej DI vI'.:sen} ▶ {vaj Duj chIj:sen:idiom}

table.name: mem
table.column: This idiomatic expression literally means "warrior ship" or "warrior instincts", due to the homophony between {Duj:n:1} and {Duj:n:2}.
▶ {vaj Duj DachIj.:sen:nolink} "You have strength of character."

table.name: mem
table.column: This idiomatic expression literally means "to navigate a warrior ship".
▶ {vaj Duj DachIj.:sen:nolink} "You have strength of character."

table.name: mem
table.column: be clever, be smart, be intelligent
vara klipsk, vara smart, vara intelligent
sois intelligent, sois intelligent, sois intelligent [AUTOTRANSLATED]
The movie "Real Genius", starring Val Kilmer, was released in 1985, the same year as the first edition of TKD. Also "Val"edictorian.

table.name: mem
table.column:
This was revealed during the Hokey-Pokey.
Smart ({val:v}) & Final ({Qav:v}) Iris Corporation was the name of a chain of grocery stores.

table.name: mem
table.column: The Chinese transliteration comes from the subtitles of {Star Trek III:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: bat-like Klingon creature, type of animal
créature Klingon ressemblant à une chauve-souris, type d'animal [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This flying beast is the closest {Qo'noS:n} equivalent to a bat. A Terran bat might be called a {tera' valqe':n:nolink}.[1]

This was revealed to provide Klingon subtitles for the 50th anniversary of the German children's TV show "Die Sendung mit der Maus".
Val Kilmer portrayed Batman in the movie "Batman Forever". ({qe':sen:nolink} was used to transliterate the letter K also in {'oqe':n}.)

table.name: mem
table.column: The 2009 {Star Trek:src} movie has a deleted scene with the line: {tIjwI'ghom bovanrupbe'chugh, vaj reQaw'.:sen:nolink}

table.name: mem
table.column: end (an event, voyage, battle, play, opera, story, song, etc.)
beenden (eine Reise, Kampf, Spiel, Oper, Lied usw.)
پایان (رویداد، سفر، نبرد، بازی، اپرا، داستان، آهنگ، و غیره) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
avsluta (en händelse, t.ex. resa, strid, sång)
конец (событие, путешествие, битва, спектакль, опера, история, песня и т. д.) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
結束（事件，航程、戰鬥、遊戲、歌劇、故事、歌曲等） [AUTOTRANSLATED]
terminar (um evento, viagem, batalha, peça, ópera, história, música etc.)
lopettaa (tapahtuma, matka, taistelu, näytelmä, ooppera, tarina, laulu tms.)
fin (un événement, un voyage, une bataille, une pièce de théâtre, un opéra, une histoire, une chanson, etc.) [AUTOTRANSLATED]

The subject of this verb is the person causing an event to end. The object is the event that is ended. If the event was prematurely brought to an end, use {ghang:v} instead. To describe the ending of a period of time, use {Dor:v:2} instead.

Das Subjekt dieses Verbes ist die Person, die ein Ereignis beendet. Das Objekt ist das Ereignis, welches beendet wird. Falls das Ereignis vorzeitig beendet wird, benutzt man {ghang:v} stattdessen. Um das Enden eines Zeitabschnitts zu beschreiben, verwendet man {Dor:v:2}.

Tämän verbin subjekti on henkilö, joka aiheuttaa tapahtuman päättymisen. Objekti on loppuva tapahtuma. Jos tapahtuma lopetettiin ennenaikaisesti, käytetään tämän sanan sijasta verbiä {ghang:v}. Ajanjakson päättymisestä käytetäänv verbiä {Dor:v:2}.

table.name: mem
table.column: A planet in the Gamma Quadrant.

table.name: mem
table.column: vangDI' tlhIngan SuvwI' ngoy' qorDu'Daj; vangDI' qorDu'Daj ngoy' tlhIngan SuvwI'.
The family of a Klingon warrior is responsible for his actions, and he is responsible for theirs.
Die Familie eines Klingonen ist verantwortlich für dessen Taten, und er ist verantwortlich für die Taten der Familie.
خانواده یک جنگجوی کلینگان مسئول اقداماتش است و مسئولیت آن را دارد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Familjen av en Klingon krigare är ansvarig för sina handlingar, och han är ansvarig för deras. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Семья клингонского воина несет ответственность за его действия, а он - за их. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
克林崗戰士的家人對他的行為負責，他負責他們的行為。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
A família de um guerreiro klingon é responsável por suas ações, e ele é responsável pelas delas.
Klingonisoturin perhe on vastuussa hänen teoistaan, ja hän on vastuussa heidän teoistaan.
La famille d'un guerrier Klingon est responsable de ses actes, et lui est responsable des leurs. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {bI'reS qeylIS vaq molor:sen:nolink} "First, Molor taunts Kahless"[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a planet in the Klingon Empire in which native languages have survived alongside Klingon.[1]
This word appears only in the body of {KGT:src} in English. The obvious Klingon spelling was subsequently confirmed at {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2022:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: be aggressive, be effective, be vigorous
vara aggressiv, vara effektiv, vara energisk, vara kraftfull
быть агрессивным, быть эффективным, быть бодрым
要有進取心、要有效、要有活力 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
ser agressivo, ser eficaz, ser vigoroso
(aseesta) olla voimakas, tehokas, hyvä; (henkilöstä) olla aggressiivinen, voimakas, tarmokas, tehokas
être agressif, être efficace, être vigoureux [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This word was originally used in describing weapons, but is now also applied to people. It has strongly positive connotations in slang.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a member of the race of shapeshifters who lead the Dominion ({ngup'a':n}).
This appears to be based on a verb {vargh:v:nolink}, but such a verb hasn't been defined.

table.name: mem
table.column: A polynomial expression consists of "var"iables and "coef"ficients ("f" being {ng:sen:nolink} written in "xifan hol").

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the seat of the Klingon government.

▶ {juHqo'Daq vaS'a' tu'lu'. ngoch luchermeH 'ej wo' San luwuqmeH pa' ghom tlhIngan yejquv DevwI'pu'. DaH che' ghawran. yejquv DevwI' moj ghawran 'e' wuqta' cho' 'oDwI' Dapu'bogh janluq pIqarD HoD.:sen:nolink} "On the Homeworld, there is a great hall where the leaders of the Klingon High Council meet to determine policy and decide upon the fate of the Empire. Gowron currently presides, named leader of the High Council by Captain Jean-Luc Picard, who was acting as Arbiter of Succession."[2]

▶ {juHqo'Daq vaS'a' tu'lu'. ngoch luchermeH 'ej wo' San luwuqmeH pa' ghom tlhIngan yejquv DevwI'pu'. DaH che' ghawran. yejquv DevwI' moj ghawran 'e' wuqta' cho' 'oDwI' Dapu'bogh janluq pIqarD HoD.:sen:nolink} "В родном мире, есть великий зал, где лидеры Клингонского высшего совета встречаются, чтобы определить политику, задать курс и решить судьбу империи. Сейчас председательствует Гаурон, лидер Высшего совета, назначенный капитаном Жаном-Люком Пикардом, который был Арбитром посвящения."[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to side-to-side distance, and does not have the metaphorical meanings such as "broad topic" or "wide range of opinions", nor is it used for the sense of "to the full extent" such as "eyes wide open".

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the nozzle on a teapot, for example. The slang term {wuS:n} (or {wuSDu':n:nolink}) "lip(s)" may also be used, depending on the shape of the spout.[1]
To "mouth off" ({mawtav:sen:nolink}) or "spout off" both mean to speak arrogantly or rudely.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a number-forming element, and not itself a number. The number 100 (one hundred) is {wa'vatlh:n:num,nolink} in Klingon.
Dies ist ein zahlenbildendes Morphem oder Element und nicht eine Zahl an sich. Die Zahl 100 (einhundert) ist {wa'vatlh:n:num,nolink} auf klingonisch.
Ceci est un morphème formant un nombre et pas un nombre en soi. Le nombre 100 (cent) est {wa'vatlh:n:num,nolink} en klingon.

table.name: mem
table.column: To indicate "centuries ago" or "centuries from now", {ret:n} and {pIq:n} are used in place of {poH:n}, respectively.[3]
The sentence from {SkyBox S15:src} has the {wa'DIch:n} in the wrong place. Also, the second occurrence of {vatlh DIS poH:n} is missing a space.
[1] {KGT:src}, [2] {SkyBox S15:src} (reprinted in {HQ 4.3, p.4-5, Sep. 1995:src}), [3] {HQ 8.3, p.3, Sep. 1999:src}

table.name: mem
table.column: The siblings of a {vav:n:nolink} are {tennuS:n} and {'e'mam:n}.

The joke with {vav:n:nolink} and {SoS:n:nolink} is that in most human languages, the words for "father" and "mother" contain simple labial sounds (typically either "b" or "p" for father, and "m" for mother), whereas the fricatives {v:sen:nolink} and {S:sen:nolink} are difficult sounds for human infants to make.

table.name: mem
table.column: In {Star Trek VI:src}, Azetbur was supposed to say {vavwI':n@@vav:n, -wI':n}. But this was said very softly, and sounded like {vavoy:n:nolink}, leading to the creation of this suffix.

table.name: mem
table.column: be ambitious, be determined, be motivated
être ambitieux, être déterminé, être motivé [AUTOTRANSLATED]

Note that this can refer to an ambitious person, but not an ambitious task.
In contrast to {pIl:v}, this refers to self-motivation.
A determined person is one who "vow"s to do something.

table.name: mem
table.column: In ascending order of ferocity, the verbs used to describe military confrontations are: {Qor:v}, {tlhaS:v}, {vay:v:nolink}, {lul:v}, {Hargh:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: Visually, "v" and "y" look triangular and there are two "y"s.

table.name: mem
table.column: کسی، چیزی، کسی، هر چیزی، کسی [AUTOTRANSLATED]
某人、某事、任何人、任何事物、某人 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
quelqu'un, quelque chose, n'importe qui, n'importe quoi [AUTOTRANSLATED]

To express an indefinite subject, see {-lu':v:suff}.
To express the ideas of indefinite subject and ability at the same time, it is not uncommon to use {vay':n:nolink} with {-laH:v:suff} (but see also {-la':v:suff} and {-luH:v:suff}).[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: Jos voit pelottaa jotakuta, olet voimakas. (Pelko on voimaa.)

table.name: mem
table.column: به یاد داشته باشید که عطر و بوی [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Jos haistat jotakin, muista se. (Muista haju.)

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to any rag or cloth or sponge (natural or artificial) used for the purpose of cleaning. While the concept exists in Klingon culture, it doesn't come up much. This word does not refer to the animal.[1]
Sounds like "mooch off" backwards. In slang, to "mooch off" or "sponge off" someone means to get something from someone without returning the favour.

table.name: mem
table.column: vara nästa, vara efterföljande (i ordning, serie)
接下來（在一系列、序列中） [AUTOTRANSLATED]
ser o próximo (em uma série, sequência)
être le prochain (dans une série, une séquence) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
To refer to the next day, month, or year, consider using {leS:n}, {waQ:n}, and {nem:n}, respectively.
While {nungbogh:v:nolink} precedes a noun, {veb:v:nolink} comes after one.

table.name: mem
table.column: This means to span or cross in a stationary sense, as for example a bridge spanning a river, two fingers crossing, or a stripe painted across the road.[1]

Dies bedeutet, stationär zu überspannen oder zu überqueren, wie zum Beispiel eine Brücke, die einen Fluss überspannt, zwei sich kreuzende Finger oder einen über die Straße gemalten Streifen. [AUTOTRANSLATED][1]
این به معنای دهانه یا عبور به معنای ثابت است ، به عنوان مثال یک پل در حال عبور از یک رودخانه ، عبور از دو انگشت یا نوار نقاشی شده در طول جاده. [AUTOTRANSLATED][1]
Detta innebär att spänna eller korsa i stationär mening, som till exempel en bro som sträcker sig över en flod, två fingrar som korsar eller en rand målad tvärs över vägen. [AUTOTRANSLATED][1]
Это означает, что он должен проходить или пересекать в стационарном смысле, например, мост через реку, пересечение двумя пальцами или полоса, нарисованная поперек дороги. [AUTOTRANSLATED][1]
這意味著要以固定的方式跨度或交叉，例如跨河的橋樑，兩個手指交叉或在道路上塗有條紋。 [AUTOTRANSLATED][1]
Isso significa atravessar ou atravessar em sentido estacionário, como por exemplo uma ponte atravessando um rio, dois dedos cruzando ou uma faixa pintada na estrada. [AUTOTRANSLATED][1]
Tämä tarkoittaa venyttämistä tai ylittämistä paikallaan, kuten esimerkiksi jokea ylittävä silta, kahden sormen ylitys tai tien yli maalattu raita. [AUTOTRANSLATED][1]

table.name: mem
table.column: The plural of this word is {veDDIrmey:n:nolink} rather than {veDDIrDu':n:nolink}.[1; 2]

table.name: mem
table.column: go through an existing opening (an open door, a tunnel, etc.)
بروید (درب باز، یک تونل و غیره) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
gå igenom (en öppen dörr, tunnel etc.)
пройти (открытая дверь, туннель и т. д.) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
passar (uma porta aberta, um túnel, etc.)
passer par une ouverture existante (une porte ouverte, un tunnel, etc.) [AUTOTRANSLATED]

This verb only means to go through an opening of some sort, and not "to traverse" (in the sense of "going through" a forest).[1] The object is the thing being gone through. {-Daq:n:suff} is unnecessary.[2]
For {vegh:v:nolink} to be applicable, the object must completely encircle the vector of travel, so it would not apply to a bridge unless it was covered over. But this need not be exact, in that a meshwork or cage-like object would count.[5] If one wanders around in a tunnel, it would not be {vegh:v:nolink}, and conversely, if a tunnel-like covered path goes through a forest, {vegh:v:nolink} might be applicable.[6]

This was the word awarded to the winning team at a contest during {qep'a' 4 (1997):src}. The requested word was "go through", and four example sentences were provided to MO to clarify the meaning: "the bullet goes through the man's heart", "the hunter goes through the forest", "the train goes through the tunnel", and "the bird goes through the [open] window". MO noted that these were three different concepts, with the latter two sentences illustrating the same idea, which is expressed by {vegh:v:nolink}.[1]
This is defined as "go through (an open door, a tunnel, etc.)" in the KLI new words list. However, other attendees wrote down different definitions, such as "go through (an existing aperture)".[1; 2]
In the chapter where the sentence {ghe'tor vegh Duj:sen:nolink} appears, the Barge of the Dead goes through Gre'thor as if it were merely an opening into Sto-vo-kor, which is why {vegh:v:nolink} is appropriate.[6]
[1] {HQ 6.3, p.5-8, Sep. 1997:src}, [2] {HQ 7.4, Dec. 1998:src}, [3] {Klingon Monopoly:src}, [4] {paq'batlh 2ed:src}, [5] {KLI mailing list 2013.07.29:src}, [6] {KLI mailing list 2022.06.24:src}

table.name: mem
table.column: This translation was used in the subtitles to {Star Trek V:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: {SkyBox 99:src} had only the Klingon text. The English and German text come from {SkyBox 01:src} and {SkyBox 95:src}, respectively, which were just translations into those languages of the same card.

▶ {loS... qIb HeHDaq, 'u' SepmeyDaq Sovbe'lu'bogh lenglu'meH He ghoSlu'bogh retlhDaq 'oHtaH. HaDlu'meH, QuSlu'meH, SuDlu'meH lojmIt Da logh Hop Hut tengchaH. vaj loghDaq lenglaHtaH Humanpu'. veH Qav 'oH logh'e'.:sen:nolink} "It waits... on the edge of the galaxy, beside a passage to unknown regions of the universe, space station Deep Space Nine is the gateway for the exploration, intrigue and enterprise that mark the continuation of the human adventure into space - the final frontier."[1]

▶ {loS... qIb HeHDaq, 'u' SepmeyDaq Sovbe'lu'bogh lenglu'meH He ghoSlu'bogh retlhDaq 'oHtaH. HaDlu'meH, QuSlu'meH, SuDlu'meH lojmIt Da logh Hop Hut tengchaH. vaj loghDaq lenglaHtaH Humanpu'. veH Qav 'oH logh'e'.:sen:nolink} "Sie wartet... am Rande der Galaxie neben einer Durchfahrt in unbekannte Regionen des Universums. Die Raumstation Deep Space Nine ist der Ausgangspunkt für Entdeckungen, Intrigen und Unternehmungen, die immer weitere Abenteuer des Menschen im Weltraum bedeuten - die letzte Grenze."[1]

table.name: mem
table.column:
The subject does the covering, while the object is covered.
This verb is used to describe the laying of a carpet. The person who lays a carpet is called a {velwI':n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the person who lays a carpet. Even though one might think (based on the meaning of {vel:v}) that {velwI':n:nolink} would be the carpet itself, it doesn't work that way.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: In {Klingon Monopoly:src}, the "Chancellor's Cane Replica" is referred to as {Qang naQ velqa':n:nolink}.[1] Life-size models of dinosaurs such as one might see in a museum may also be referred to as {velqa':n:nolink}.[2]
"Revell" is a company which makes model kits ({-qa':v} means "again", or "re-").

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to elemental chromium, whereas {qo'rIn:n} refers to chromium salts like the ones used in leather tanning.
This appears to be a combination of {vel:v} and {So':v:1}. Chromium is often used to coat things.

table.name: mem
table.column: A common way to express this is with {chenmoH:v}.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: print, mark, tracks, trace, image, pattern
چاپ، علامت گذاری، آهنگ، ردیابی، تصویر، الگوی [AUTOTRANSLATED]
skriva ut, markera, spåra, spåra, bild, mönster [AUTOTRANSLATED]
печать, отметка, дорожки, след, изображение, рисунок [AUTOTRANSLATED]
打印、標記、軌道、跟踪、圖像、模式 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
imprimir, marca, faixas, rastreamento, imagem, padrão
impression, marque, traces, trace, image, motif [AUTOTRANSLATED]

This refers to the trace or marks left behind by touch, such as (the image of) a fingerprint, tire tracks, or the pattern in the dirt that results from stepping on it.
This word is contrasted with {Su'nIm:n} which refers to the pattern that makes the {vem:n:nolink}. But {Su'nIm:n:nolink} is used only when it's something very detailed which leaves the {vem:n:nolink}. For example, compare {nItlh Su'nIm:n} "fingerprint" (ridges on fingertip) with {nItlh Su'nIm vem:n} "fingerprint" (mark left behind after touching).
Note that an intentionally produced, stamp-like image is a {yang:n}.
In the following examples, the specific finger or toe name can be used instead of {nItlh:n} (or {yaD:n:1}).

▶ {nItlh Su'nIm vem:n@@nItlh:n, Su'nIm:n, vem:n} fingerprint (mark left behind after touching) ▶ {bem Su'nIm vem:n@@bem:n, Su'nIm:n, vem:n} footprint (specific pattern of bottom of shoe) ▶ {bem vem:n@@bem:n, vem:n} footprint (basic outline of a foot left in dirt) ▶ {namwech vem:n@@namwech:n, vem:n} paw print (pattern left in dirt)

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a bird that feeds almost exclusively on the serpent worm from which {qagh:n} is made. Klingons are not particularly fond of this bird.
An early bird, i.e., a bird which wakes up ({vem:v}) early ({'eq:v}), catches the worm.

table.name: mem
table.column: This word describes someone who is really into something (or a number of things), who partakes in activities associated with it, and does so very seriously.
A reference to "The Nerdy Venoms" podcast, on which Okrand had been invited as a guest at the time.

table.name: mem
table.column:
This word describes someone who is really into something (or a number of things), who partakes in activities associated with it, and does so very seriously.
A more common term for this is {qatru':n:nolink}.

table.name: mem
mem
table.column: 第一城（克洛诺斯的首都）
This word appears only in the body of {KGT:src} and not in the glossary.

table.name: mem
table.column: eräs Kronoksen alue, Ensimmäisen kaupungin alue
This word appears only in the body of {KGT:src} and not in the glossary.

table.name: mem
table.column: proclamation, notification, announcement, advertisement, and the like
اعلان، اطلاع رسانی، اعلام، و مانند آن [AUTOTRANSLATED]
proklamation, kungörelse, avisering, tillkännagivande, reklam etc.
объявление, уведомление, объявление и т. д. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
The type of advertisement can be further specified: {ngevwI' vep:n@@ngevwI':n, vep:n}, {Suy vep:n@@Suy:n, vep:n}, {rubyo' vep:n@@rubyo':n, vep:n}, etc.[2]
Die Art der Werbung kann genauer spezifiziert werden: {ngevwI' vep:n@@ngevwI':n, vep:n}, {Suy vep:n@@Suy:n, vep:n}, {rubyo' vep:n@@rubyo':n, vep:n}, etc.[2]
Vilken slags reklam kan vara ytterligare specificerad: {ngevwI' vep:n@@ngevwI':n, vep:n}, {Suy vep:n@@Suy:n, vep:n}, {rubyo' vep:n@@rubyo':n, vep:n}, etc.[2]
Le type de publicité peut être spécifié de plus: {ngevwI' vep:n@@ngevwI':n, vep:n}, {Suy vep:n@@Suy:n, vep:n}, {rubyo' vep:n@@rubyo':n, vep:n}, etc.[2]
At {qep'a' 24 (2017):src}, this was defined as "proclamation, notification, announcement, and the like".[1] At {qep'a' 32 (2025):src}, this was expanded to include "advertisement".[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: eräs myyttinen olento, Fek'lhr, demoni, paholainen
There is an idiom, {qej; veqlargh rur@@qej:v, veqlargh:n, rur:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: You pay attention to your Fek'lhr and I will pay attention to mine.
Du passt auf deinen Fek'lhr auf und ich achte auf meinen.
شما به Fek'lhr خود توجه می کنید و من به معدن توجه خواهم کرد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Du uppmärksammar din Fek'lhr och jag kommer att uppmärksamma mina. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Вы обращаете внимание на свой Fek'lhr, а я обращаю внимание на мой. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
你注意你的Fek'lhr，我會關注我的。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Você presta atenção ao seu Fek'lhr e eu prestarei atenção ao meu.
Keskity omaan Fek'lhriisi ja minä keskityn omaani.
Faites attention à votre Fek'lhr et je ferai attention au mien. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: The VeK'tal response is a measure of a Klingon's physiological condition.[1] It's a bad sign if it falls rapidly.[2]
Die VeK'tal-Reaktion ist ein Hinweis auf den physiologischen Zustand eines Klingonen.[1] Eine niedrige VeK'tal-Reaktion nichts gutes bedeutet.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: Siehe wie Gowron dies sagt: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/PBM4fiXLc-U}

table.name: mem
table.column: Your ship is a garbage scow.
Seu navio é uma embarcação de lixo.
Votre navire est un chaland à ordures. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This word can be used to talk about the wind ({SuS:n}). For example, {ver SuS'a':sen@@ver:v:1, SuS:n, -'a':n} means "a tornado happens". {ver SuS:sen@@ver:v:1, SuS:n} or {ver SuSHom:sen@@ver:v:1, SuS:n, -Hom:n} would most likely refer to a whirlwind.

Mit diesem Wort kann man den Wind ({SuS:n}) beschreiben. Zum Beispiel {ver SuS'a':sen@@ver:v:1, SuS:n, -'a':n} bedeutet "es findet ein Tornado statt". {ver SuS:sen@@ver:v:1, SuS:n} oder {ver SuSHom:sen@@ver:v:1, SuS:n, -Hom:n} würde wahrscheinlich einen Wirbelwind beschreiben.

table.name: mem
table.column: In context, this can also refer to a button for clothing (see {Sut veragh:n}).

table.name: mem
table.column: Ferengis are known for their greed, as reflected in the comparison {qur; verengan rur@@qur:v, verengan:n, rur:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the name of the Ferengi Homeworld, the primary planet in the Ferengi Alliance.
Ferengien kotimaailma ja Ferengien liittouman pääplaneetta.

table.name: mem
table.column: Siehe wie Gowron dies sagt: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/8MLXFbHYZOk}

table.name: mem
table.column: quai, port (port maritime, aéroport, port spatial) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This refers to a place with a structure to attach a vessel to, like a pier.[2]
This was defined only as "dock" in {TKD:src}. The definition was expanded at {qep'a' 25 (2018):src}.

table.name: mem
table.column:
The object is the vehicle that is docked.[3]
In {Klingon Monopoly:src}, "Free Parking" is translated as {vergh 'ach DIlnISbe':sen:nolink}.
▶ {nuqDaq puH Duj vIvergh?:sen:nolink} "Where can I park the car?"[3]

table.name: mem
table.column: war, warfare (concept or idea of war)
guerre, guerre (concept ou idée de guerre) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Contrast this with {noH:n}, which refers to a specific war.[1, p.47]

table.name: mem
table.column: From lowest to highest, these ranks are: {tay:n:3}, {Sutay:n}, {veStay:n:nolink}, {Santay:n}, {'Iptay:n}.
This is a rank from John M. Ford's 1984 novel "The Final Reflection". These ranks are used by many Klingon fan clubs, despite not appearing in canon (i.e., in any TV episode or movie).

table.name: mem
table.column: Marc Okrand decided to put this word into {TKD:src} because he thought that if any animal survives into the future, it would surely be the cockroach.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: insert, put in, pin (attach or fasten with a pin)
قرار دادن، قرار دادن، پین (با یک پین وصل یا وصل کنید) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
sätt in, sätt in, stift (fäst eller fäst med en stift) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
вставьте, вставьте штифт (прикрепите или закрепите штифтом) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
插入、放入、銷（用別針固定或固定） [AUTOTRANSLATED]
inserir, colocar, prender (prender ou amarrar com um prendedor)
insérer, insérer, épingler (attacher ou fixer avec une épingle) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This might be used for inserting a staple into paper, a letter into an envelope, or a pen into a pen holder.[1] This is one possible verb to use with {watrIn:n}.[3]
This was defined as "insert, put in" in 2015.[1] It was expanded to include "pin, attach or fasten with a pin" in 2016.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: If the things in the set are connected or arranged in some way, then an appropriate word might be {qol:n:1h}.[2]
In the "Limited Edition" example, since {veymey:n:nolink} is plural, the correct grammar should have {luchenmoHlu'pu':v:nolink}.

▶ {veymey puS neH chenmoHlu'pu':sen:nolink} "Limited Edition" ▶ {boSwI'vaD veyvam le' chenmoHlu':sen:nolink} "Collector's Edition" ▶ {wa' tlhIngan QaS vey:n:nolink} "one pack of Klingon forces" ▶ {'echletHom vey:n}

table.name: mem
table.column: olla reilusti, runsaasti, olla enemmän kuin riittävä
This is similar to {yap:v}, but {vey':v:nolink} implies being more than enough/sufficient.
Dies ist ähnlich wie {yap:v}, aber {vey':v:nolink} bedeutet mehr als nur genug.
Tämä tarkoittaa, että jokin on tai jotakin on enemmän kuin riittävästi ({yap:v}).

table.name: mem
table.column: être mal à l'aise, être maigre [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This means more than not being enough or being insufficient (see {yap:v}).
Dies ist noch weniger als zu wenig oder unzureichend (siehe {yap:v}).
Tämän sana on merkitykseltään voimakkaampi kuin ilmaus "ei riittävä" ({yap:v}).

table.name: mem
table.column: travel with a purpose, for a specific reason; travel on a mission
mit einer Absicht bzw. Mission reisen
برای اهداف خاص سفر کنید سفر به یک ماموریت [AUTOTRANSLATED]
resa med ett syfte, av en särskild anledning resa på ett uppdrag [AUTOTRANSLATED]
путешествовать с целью, по определенной причине; путешествовать на миссии [AUTOTRANSLATED]
出於特定原因有目的地旅行;旅行團 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
viajar com um propósito, por um motivo específico; viajar em missão
matkustaa tarkoituksella tai tehtävällä, tietystä syystä
voyager dans un but précis, pour une raison précise ; voyager en mission [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: Idiomatically, wavy hair is said to "travel aimlessly" or something like that. Straight hair would be described as {tlhep:v}.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This was incorrectly given as "tension (electric)" in the booklet.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column:
{jIH:n:1h}:{ghaH:n}/{'oH:n}/{chaH:n}/{bIH:n} = {vI-:v:pref,nolink}
When used with {-lu':v}, this prefix means "Someone (indefinite subject) does something to me".

table.name: mem
table.column: move through time toward the future
durch die Zeit in die Zukunft reisen
از زمان به سمت آینده حرکت کردن [AUTOTRANSLATED]
avançar no tempo em direção ao futuro
voyager dans le temps vers le futur
▶ {wa'vatlh DIS vIvIb:sen:nolink} "I time-travel 100 years into the future." ▶ {jIvIb. qaSDI' vatlh DIS poH cha'maH Hut, jImev.:sen:nolink} "I time-travel to the 29th century."

table.name: mem
table.column: This was defined parenthetically in the definition of {vIb:v:1,nolink}. The note that this is not used in reference to plants implies that this means "to be transmitted, as through a medium", and not "to breed".

table.name: mem
table.column: move through time toward the past
durch die Zeit in die Vergangenheit reisen
از زمان به سمت گذشته حرکت کردن [AUTOTRANSLATED]
flytta genom tiden mot det förflutna [AUTOTRANSLATED]
avançar através do tempo em direção ao passado
voyager dans le temps vers le passé
▶ {jIvIbHa'pu' 'ej qeylIS vIqIHpu'.:sen:nolink} "I time-traveled into the past and I met Kahless." ▶ {jIvIbHa'. wejHu' jImev.:sen:nolink} "I time-travel three days into the past."

table.name: mem
table.column: vara stridslysten, vara stridande, vara krigförande

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a device that regulates the flow of gas, sound, etc.

table.name: mem
table.column: type of animal, v'gro (like a cat)
tipo de animal, v'gro (como um gato)
type d'animal, v'gro (ressemble à un chat)
"Figaro" is the name of the cat in Disney's Pinocchio. This word isn't named directly for that, but via an actual cat named "Figaro".

table.name: mem
table.column:
This verb is intransitive. To say that someone or something moves someone or something else, use {vIHmoH:v:nolink}.[2]
For an idiomatic expression used to tell someone not to move, see {taD:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This idiomatic expression means that an activity of finite (though perhaps indeterminate) length has started. It originates from {qa'vaQ:n}.
▶ {bISop DaneH'a'? vIHtaH gho.:sen:nolink} "If you want to eat, say so now before the food is gone."

table.name: mem
table.column: avoir des crêtes , avoir des arêtes (du front)
See {Hut'In vIl:n} for the pun behind {vIl:v:nolink}.

table.name: mem
table.column: someone or something who is just there, someone who is around when you are
jemand oder etwas das immer da ist
کسی یا چیزی که فقط وجود دارد کسی که در اطراف شما هست [AUTOTRANSLATED]
кто-то или что-то, кто только там; кто-то, кто рядом, когда ты [AUTOTRANSLATED]
某人或某物就在那裡;你身邊的人 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
alguém ou algo que está lá; alguém que está por perto quando você está
joku tai jokin, joka on aina läsnä kun itse on läsnä; hidaste, töyssy?
quelqu'un ou quelque chose qui est simplement là, quelqu'un qui est partout où l'on est
When this word was defined at {qep'a' 16 (2009):src}, a description of an object which was recognised as a "speed bump" was given as an example of a {vIl:n:nolink}.

table.name: mem
table.column: 追隨者、門徒、粉絲、崇拜者、奴才 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
disciple, partisan, adepte, fidèle, fan, admirateur, supporteur, laquais

table.name: mem
table.column: The suggestion was made at {qep'a' 16 (2009):src} that a {vIlHom:n:nolink} could be a single ridge in a {Quch:n}. This was affirmed by MO.

table.name: mem
table.column: en slags fågel (förmögen att härma språk)
eräs papukaijaa muistuttava lintu (joka osaa jäljitellä puhetta)
This is a bird capable of mimicking speech. Some people pluralize this word with {-pu':n:suff}, but most use {-mey:n:suff}.
This is a reference to Captain Flint, Long John Silver's parrot in "Treasure Island".

table.name: mem
table.column: {lor:n:0} eller {tey':n:0}; kusin, brorsdotter, systerdotter, brorson, systerson

In the singular, typically {tey':n:nolink} or {lor:n:nolink} is preferred unless the individual is being referred to as a member of a group that likely includes both {tey':n:nolink} and/or {lor:n:nolink}. The plural form {vInpu':n:nolink} is used for a group that includes {tey':n:nolink} and/or {lor:n:nolink}.
A reference to the movie "My Cousin Vinny".

table.name: mem
table.column: compatriot, community member, cohort, fellow citizen
Landsmann, Mitbürger, Mitglied der Mannschaft oder der Truppe
هموطن، عضو جامعه، همکار، شهروند دیگر [AUTOTRANSLATED]
同胞、社區成員、同夥、同胞 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
compatriota, membro da comunidade, coorte, concidadão
compatriote, membre de la communauté, comparse, concitoyen

This most commonly refers to people, in which case it takes the suffix {-pu':n:suff}. However, in scientific contexts, it may be used as a shortened form of {tamler vInDa':n}, in which case it takes the suffix {-mey:n:suff}.[3]
The example sentence is a lip-match for {'ej DochmeywIj vItlhapqa'meH}.
▶ {'ej Dojmey wID, vInDa'ma' peq.:sen@@'ej:conj, Dojmey:n, wID:v, vInDa':n, -ma':n, peq:v} "He has killed many of our people."[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This word refers to the abstract concept of combat. A specific battle is a {may':n}.
The TV show "Combat!" starred Vic Morrow.

table.name: mem
table.column: This term is more general than a visual piece of art. It covers that, but also an artifact (not in the archeological sense), handicraft, gizmo, gadget, contraption, machine, device, etc. That is, it refers to something manufactured or made.[1] It could be used for a product produced by a company (if the product was physical).[2]
Tämä termi kattaa valmistetut fyysiset esineet, kuten taideteokset, käsityöt, koneet, laitteet ja keksinnöt[1]. Sitä voi käyttää yrityksen valmistamista fyysisistä tuotteista[2].
artefakti, käsityö, vehje, vekotin, kapine, keksintö, esine

table.name: mem
table.column: This means to be deprived of air. For "drown", precede the verb with {bIQDaq:sen@@bIQ:n, -Daq:n} or the like.
This was confirmed not to take an object.

table.name: mem
table.column: This means to cause someone/something to be deprived of air. For "drown", precede the verb with {bIQDaq:sen@@bIQ:n, -Daq:n} or the like.

table.name: mem
table.column: پاره شدن (تا) ، بریدن ، پارگی (تا) ، گش کردن [AUTOTRANSLATED]
撕裂（向上），斜線，撕裂（向上），煤氣 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
For example, this would be used for ripping a photo in half.

table.name: mem
table.column: تمام سلاح ها برای کنترل من! [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Todas as armas sob meu controle!
Transférer toutes les armes à mon contrôle !

table.name: mem
table.column: teste da verdade, duelo da verdade
examen de vérité, duel de vérité
It's not specified whether this is a noun or a verb, but it's likely to be a noun, even though {Hay':n:nolink,hyp} is not known to exist as a noun.

table.name: mem
table.column: be high, be great (in quantity, size, intensity)
hoch, viel sein (in Menge, Abmessung, Intensität)
بالا بودن، عالی (در مقدار، اندازه، شدت) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
vara hög, stor (i kvantitet, storlek, intensitet) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
быть высоким, отличным (по количеству, размеру, интенсивности) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
很高、很棒（數量、大小、強度） [AUTOTRANSLATED]
ser alto, grande (em quantidade, tamanho, intensidade)
olla korkea (nopeus tms.), olla suuri (määrällisesti, kooltaan, voimakkuudeltaan)
être haut, être élevé (en quantité, taille, intensité)

This is used for things that are measurable or quantifiable, but not necessarily countable. For countable things, {law':v} would normally be used, but {vItlh:v:nolink} would be used if the number is higher than normal or greater than before or greater than what was expected.[3]
▶ {DoDaj vItlh law' wab Do vItlh puS.:sen:nolink} "faster than the speed of sound"[1] ▶ {Do vItlh:n:nolink} "high velocity"[3] ▶ {chuq vItlh:n:nolink} "great range, great distance"[3]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is any liquid from a plant. In some regional dialects, this word is used for any liquid accompanying food, as if a general term for sauce.[1, p.27]
"V8" is a juice blend made from tomato juice mixed with the juices of various vegetables.

table.name: mem
table.column: Earwax (see {Serrum:n}) is said to do this in the ear.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {cha' vI' vagh choQmey lutoghlu':sen:nolink} "Number of Decks: 2.5" {BoP:src}

table.name: mem
table.column: This noun may refer to anything considered the best work or accomplishment of somebody.[1]
The TNG episode "The Masterpiece Society" takes place on Moab IV.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a reference to Phileas Fogg, the protagonist of the Jules Verne novel "Around the World in Eighty Days".

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers both to the soft flexible barrier put in frames (for windows or doors) to keep insects out and to the material, whatever it's used for.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: The Tide brand of laundry detergent is also sold under the mark Vizir. (Note that {vI'Ir:n:nolink} written in "xifan hol" is "vizir".)

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a shortened version of {voDmeH jan:n} which is often heard.

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the entire device, not just the drill bit. This is often shortened to {voD jan:n}.
This is defined as "drill". The word "device" was added to disambiguate this from (and to be consistent in appearance with) {qeq:n} "drill (military)".

table.name: mem
table.column:
This is a spider-like creature with nine legs, but sometimes seven or eight (and not fewer than seven unless it is injured).
A large spider on Earth would be a {tera' voDchuch:n@@tera':n, voDchuch:n}, but a small spider would not be a {voDchuch:n:nolink}.
{voD:v} "bore" + {chuch:n} "ice" = Boris. "Boris the Spider" is a song by The Who.

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to meat prepared by {HaH:v:2}. The word for the specific meat replaces the word {Ha'DIbaH:n:1}.

table.name: mem
table.column: When used as a locative, this word is not followed by the locative suffix {-Daq:n:suff}.[3]

MO was asked whether {vogh:n:nolink} can be used as a locative (without {-Daq:n:suff}) at {qep'a' 22 (2015):src} ({KLI mailing list 2015.08.05:src}). He answered that it probably could but wasn't sure and had to check. Subsequently, he confirmed this at {qep'a' 24 (2017):src} ({KLI mailing list 2017.07.30:src}).
▶ {vogh vISuch vIneH.:sen:nolink} "I want to visit some place."[2] ▶ {vogh tIghla' tu'lu':sen:nolink} "there's a t'gla somewhere"[3]

table.name: mem
table.column: This word can be the object of {wel:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This word is used in {Klingon Monopoly:src} to denote how many {QaS:n:1h} the player receives for mortgaging a planet to the bank.

table.name: mem
table.column: 窗格、面板、床單（不適用於床） [AUTOTRANSLATED]
carreau, panneau, feuille (pas de papier ou d'un arbre)
This is a term related to artwork.

table.name: mem
table.column: snara, snärja, fånga (i fälla), förleda, lura
This is a reference to Captain "von Trapp" from The Sound of Music, who was played by Christopher Plummer, who of course was also General Chang ({cheng:n:name}).

table.name: mem
table.column: This slang term is not used in reference to games, but is applied only to more serious matters.[1, p.165]
Note that in the example, the prefix {bI-:v} is used rather than {Da-:v}. This might indicate that the apparent {-lu':v} suffix is a fossilized form and isn't truly the suffix.

table.name: mem
table.column: lita på, tro på, ha tillit till
faire confiance à, avoir confiance en

table.name: mem
table.column: ei luottaa, epäillä, tuntea epäluottamusta jotakin kohtaan

table.name: mem
table.column: Voq was an outcast who referred to himself as "son of none" ({pagh puqloD:n@@pagh:n:1, puqloD:n}). He is a follower of {tIquvma:n:name}, and was given the role of {Sech qengwI':n} after the death of {rej'aq:n:name}. He is an albino, whose skin colour was described as {Dem:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: kväva, kvävas, strypa, strypas, få något i halsen
The similar-looking {vIQ:v:nolink} does not take an object, but it is unclear whether {voQ:v:nolink} does or not.

table.name: mem
table.column: This word appears to consist of the verb {voQ:v} (or a homophonous but unknown noun) and {SIp:n}, so it means something like "choking gas".

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {Hoch vor Dargh wIb.:sen:nolink} "Sour tea cures everything."[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: It is unclear why Federation Standard corrupted the spelling of this word by moving the {qaghwI':n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {tera' DIS wa' Hut vagh Hut, bI'reS puv 'amerI'qa' 'ev chan 'ev X-wa'maH vagh. muDDaq neH muD Dujmey vorgh lu'orlu', 'ach loghDaq puvlaH Dujmey 'orbogh nuv 'e' 'agh X-wa'maH vagh.:sen:nolink} "First flown in 1959, the North American X-15 bridged the gap between human flight in the atmosphere and spaceflight."[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This word appears only in the body of {KGT:src} and not in the glossary.

table.name: mem
table.column:
The requested word was "tackle", defined as "seize and knock to the ground".
It was stated during the Q & A session that the primary meaning of this word is physical (i.e., it does not mean "wrestling" with a problem). The object is the person being grappled, but MO would have to think about whether it can be a body part.

table.name: mem
table.column: The object of this verb is the original, not the clone. This refers to cloning in the biological sense, and not in the sense of a computer operation.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This means to cause something to move (typically forward), regardless of how it is accomplished, whereas {ghoS:v:2} involves pushing something at or into something else.[3]

table.name: mem
table.column: Nicht im Sinne eines materiellen Bilds.
Pas dans le sens d'un image physique.

table.name: mem
table.column: This "imagery" refers to a general impression, metaphor, simile, mental idea, and the like, not a physical image like a drawing or something on a view screen.[1]

Dies bezieht sich auf einen allgemeinen Eindruck, Metapher, Vergleich, bildliche Vorstellung, Bild im Kopf und Ähnliches, nicht auf ein materielles Bild, wie eine Zeichnung oder etwas auf einem Bildschirm.[1]
Ce mot se réfère à une impression générale, métaphore, comparaison, idée mentale et similaire, pas un image physique comme une peinture ou un image sur un écran.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the fraction of a wave cycle. It is not used for phases of the moon or phases of life and so on.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the name of a Federation starship.

table.name: mem
table.column: Cowards take hostages. Klingons do not.
بزدل گروگان ها را می گیرند کلینگان ها نمی کنند [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Cowards tar gisslan. Klingons gör det inte. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
懦夫劫持人質。克林崗人沒有。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Les lâches prennent des otages. Les Klingons ne le font pas.

table.name: mem
mem
table.column: This is a substance and (like {'Iw:n:nolink}) probably doesn't take a plural suffix.

table.name: mem
table.column: This verb can be used with {turmIq:n}, {qeQ:n}, and {taQbang:n:2}.

table.name: mem
table.column:
Vulcans are also sometimes called Vulcanians in English.[2]
Note that this is {vulqangan:n:nolink} and not {vulqanngan:n:nolink} (the {n:sen:nolink} at the end of {vulqan:n:nolink} is dropped).
There is a Klingon idiom, {nong; vulqangan rur@@nong:v:1, vulqangan:n, rur:v}, which is meant ironically.
This transliteration is used in the subtitles of {Star Trek V:src} among other places.

Vulkanuslaisia kutsutaan suomessa joskus myös vulkaneiksi.
Huomaa, että tämä sana on {vulqangan:n:nolink} eikä {vulqanngan:n:nolink} ({n:sen:nolink} sanan {vulqan:n:nolink} lopussa putoaa pois).
On sanonta {nong; vulqangan rur@@nong:v:1, vulqangan:n, rur:v}, jota käytetään ivallisesti.

table.name: mem
table.column: In an interview with the Smithsonian's {Air & Space Magazine:src}, Dr. Okrand was asked about his fondest memory working on Star Trek. His answer was, {vulqan Hol jatlhlaHmeH Mr. Spock, vIghojmoHta'. pItlh.:sen:nolink}[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: contemptible or despicable person, scumbag, bastard
verächtliche oder verabscheuungswürdige Person, Drecksack, Bastard
حقیر یا نفرت انگیز ، عقب ، حرامزاده [AUTOTRANSLATED]
föraktig eller avskyvärd person, scumbag, bastard [AUTOTRANSLATED]
презренный или презренный человек, подонок, ублюдок [AUTOTRANSLATED]
卑鄙或卑鄙的人、卑鄙小人、私生子 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
eräs haukkumasana, halveksittava henkilö, kusipää, paskiainen, mäntti
personne méprisable ou ignoble, salaud, charogne

The first part of the example sentence was a lip-match for {mughojmoH parmaqqaywI':sen@@mu-:v, ghojmoH:v, parmaqqay:n, -wI':n}. The second part was a lip-match for {'ej jIHvo' nIHDI' jIbup:sen@@'ej:conj, jIH:n:1h, -vo':n, nIH:v, -DI':v, jI-:v, bup:v}.

▶ {potlhmo' batlh, vIqawba', 'ej chIvo' neH chIw vum'e'.@@potlh:v, -mo':v, batlh:n, vI-:v, qaw:v, -ba':v, 'ej:conj, chIvo':n, neH:adv, chIw:v, vum:n, -'e':n} "Because you care about honor. And this man has none."[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: order (in a restaurant, from a catalog, etc.)
سفارش (در یک رستوران، از کاتالوگ، و غیره) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
beställning (i en restaurang, från en katalog, etc.) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
заказ (в ресторане, по каталогу и т. д.) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
pedido (em um restaurante, de um catálogo etc.)
commander (dans un restaurant, d'un catalogue, etc.)

table.name: mem
table.column: um ciclone ou furacão se inciam
Note that this is a verb in Klingon. In Klingon, one says "it hurricanes", similar to how one says "it rains" in English.

table.name: mem
table.column: tycka synd om, ha medlidande med, beklaga
plaindre, avoir de la pitié pour

table.name: mem
mem
table.column: be modern, be up-to-date, be state-of-the-art
مدرن، مدرن، مدرن و مدرن است [AUTOTRANSLATED]
ser moderno, atualizado, de última geração
olla moderni, ajan tasalla, uusinta uutta
être moderne, être à jour, être le dernier cri, être de pointe

table.name: mem
table.column: cook, prepare food, make a beverage
طبخ، آماده کردن غذا، یک نوشیدنی [AUTOTRANSLATED]
做飯、準備食物、做一個飲料 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
cozinhar, preparar alimentos, fazer uma bebida
cuisiner, préparer à manger, préparer une boisson
The definition in {TKD:src} is just "cook". On {KGT p.83:src}, this is expanded to include the preparation of any food, including beverages. Reverse of {tuv:v}.
